timeline.summary: An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York sent a proposed protective order to Chris and Mark regarding the case *U.S. v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The order was attached as a Word document and anticipates beginning discovery production shortly after the court finalizes it. The sender requests feedback on any questions or issues.

15 Civ. 7433) against her. New, critical information has emerged impacting both this case and a related criminal action (20 Cr. 330) involving U.S. v. Maxwell. This information relates to Maxwell’s due process rights and Fourth, Fifth, and Sixth Amendment protections. Counsel seeks a temporary three-week stay of the unsealing process to allow for consultation with the U.S. Attorney's Office and a potential modification of the protective order. They propose streamlining the unsealing process through modifications to the protocol, including reduced briefing page limits and a shorter objection response period. Counsel also requests the court allow for a 7-day period for Non-Parties to object after a sealing order. Finally, they propose prioritizing specific decided motions for unsealing, excluding those tied to the paused deposition transcripts.

This email discusses materials from a DAG (Data Analysis Group) meeting held on November 5, 2020. Attached documents include bullet points outlining discussion points (signed off by the sender and Russell) and a revised memo. The email details ongoing investigations, specifically regarding the U.S. v. Maxwell case, noting potential press attention if Ghislaine Maxwell secures victim identities and ongoing efforts with another Epstein co-conspirator. The sender assumes details about anticipated press-generating cases are contained in a cover note.

On December 1, 2020, Bobbi Sternheim (of Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim) was revising a letter regarding a U.S. v. Maxwell case, specifically a defense request concerning a warden at the MDC. The revisions were intended as a “joint submission” per court order.  Lam (USANYS) had previously sent a draft of the letter, requesting circulation.  Sternheim confirmed the revisions didn’t change positions and the letter was planned for filing by 7:30 PM.  Covid-19 related office closures and communication protocols were noted.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an email attachment, a courtesy copy of an ECF filing, regarding the case U.S. v. Maxwell 20 Cr. 330 (MN). The attachment was a .htm file titled "Maxwell_Reply_to_90-day_conditions.pdf".

Bobbi Sternheim sent an email to [REDACTED], Christian, and Jeff Pagliuca regarding the U.S. v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The email attached a courtesy copy of an ECF filing, specifically a letter concerning MDC conditions (“MDC Conditions_Letter_2-16_FINAL.pdf”) and a related HTML document (“ATT00001.htm”).

An email was sent from Bobbi C. Sternheim to multiple recipients, including IMSYS and Christian Everdell, on February 23, 2021. The email attached a courtesy copy of an Electronic Correspondence Filing (ECF) related to the U.S. v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330). The email contained a disclaimer regarding confidential and privileged information. The document referenced is MAXWELL_BAIL_APPLICATION_with_EXHIBIT_2-23-17.pdf.

Email correspondence regarding the case *U.S. v. Maxwell 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)*.  Multiple individuals, including Bobbi C. Sternheim, Laura Menninger, Jeff Pagliuca, and Christian Everdell, exchanged emails related to an Electronic Case File (ECF) filing concerning a bail application for Maxwell. The email chain indicates a previous unsuccessful attempt (“third time’s the charm”) related to the case.

Bobbi C. Sternheim sent a courtesy copy of an ECF filing (MAXWELL_BAIL_APPLICATION_with_EXHIBIT_2-23-17.pdf) related to the case *U.S. v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) to several recipients, including Christian Everdell, Laura Mennin, and Jeff Pagliuca. The email contains a confidentiality and privilege disclaimer.

An email chain discusses a bail application for Maxwell in U.S. v. Maxwell 20 Cr. 330 (AJN). Bobbi Sternheim sent a copy of the application to [REDACTED] and requested a discussion regarding Maxwell’s proposed financial conditions before drafting a response. The email chain includes acknowledgements of the application’s unusual nature and a disclaimer regarding confidential information contained within the attached documents.

This solicitation/contract (I5JA54-21-PR-0199) is for expert witness services for the U.S. Attorney’s Office, Southern District of New York, related to the case of *U.S. v. Maxwell*. The contract, awarded on March 8, 2021, involves providing services such as document review, data analysis, and testimony related to the psychological aspects of sexual abuse.  The contractor, Lisa M. Rocchio & Associates, Inc., will be compensated at $450 per hour. Key provisions include adherence to DOJ security requirements, including data protection measures and compliance with relevant FAR clauses (specifically 52.212-5 and 52.222-3). The scope of work is defined as providing expert testimony for the trial and may include collaboration with the USAO in obtaining additional expert witnesses. The contract duration is subject to potential extensions.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an email to multiple recipients, including Christian Everdell, Laura Mennin, and Jeff Pagliuc, providing a courtesy copy of an Electronic Correspondence Filing (ECF) regarding U.S. v. Maxwell S2 (20 Cr. 330 (ALN)). The attached documents include a letter dated April 6th, 2021.

v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (MN)). The review will primarily take place at 500 Pearl Street, facilitated by the Marshals and FBI. Key aspects of the plan include: *   **Scheduling:** The review is planned to begin around 8:30 AM daily, with the option to start earlier at 8:00 AM. *   **Location:** The review will occur in the proffer rooms on the 5th floor of 500 Pearl Street. *   **Evidence Transport:** The FBI will transport physical evidence to 500 Pearl Street for review. Some items (cash, certain electronics, bulky photos, and shredded paper) will *not* be transported due to their size, sensitivity, or other reasons. *   **Electronic Evidence:** The FBI will provide laptops for viewing and photographing highly confidential electronic images, although access will be limited to a single laptop. They will provide digital copies of the audio recordings, but won't be playable with a standard VCR. *   **Access & Restrictions:** The defense team will have access to the evidence, but photographic restrictions apply to “highly confidential” items. A private meeting space will be provided. *   **Maxwell’s Appearance:** Ms. Maxwell will be produced to 500 Pearl Street on April 13th and every day thereafter until the review is complete. *   **Spreadsheets:** The government provides updated spreadsheets indicating the designation of evidence (Confidential/Highly Confidential) and where items will be available for review. The correspondence outlines various questions and requests from the defense team regarding the evidence, logistics, and access, with the government responding to these requests and detailing the plan for the review.

Attorney’s Office (Southern District of New York) and Bobbi Sternheim, attorney for Maxwell, regarding the review of evidence in the *U.S. v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330) case. Key individuals involved include Laura Menninger (Haddon, Morgan & Foreman) and Jeff Pagliuca (HMFLaw). *   **Evidence Logistics:** The core of the emails focuses on the arrangement of evidence review. The government proposes the use of the 500 Pearl Street location, with a proposed review schedule starting April 13th, running daily until completion. *   **Physical Evidence Access:** The U.S. Attorney's Office agreed to allow Sternheim’s team to inspect and photograph certain physical evidence at the Bronx warehouse, excluding specific items (cash, some electronics) based on their size or potential confidentiality. *   **Electronic Evidence Review:** The government intends to provide the defense with electronic evidence (images and recordings) for review at 500 Pearl Street, although access to the data may require specific equipment. There are proposed safeguards in place regarding the handling of highly confidential electronic images. *   **Maxwell’s Appearance:** The government confirms Maxwell will be produced to 500 Pearl Street on April 13th and every day thereafter. *   **Protective Order & Confidentiality:** Throughout the correspondence, the importance of the Protective Order and maintaining confidentiality is repeatedly emphasized.  A detailed spreadsheet outlines the designated “Confidential” and “Highly Confidential” items. *   **Ongoing Coordination:** The letters establish an ongoing communication and logistical coordination process between the prosecution and defense teams.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an email dated April 14, 2021, regarding the U.S. v. Maxwell S2 case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The email included a request, a proposed order for Marshall, and supporting documents: a letter, a HTML document, and another proposed order. The email was sent to Nathan Chambers, Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca.

Law Clerk Nathan Chambers responded to David Oscar Markus’s request for permission to bring electronic devices into the courthouse for the U.S. v. Maxwell case (20-Cr-330). Chambers stated that all communications with Judge Nathan must be docketed on ECF unless a request to seal is made, and Judge Nathan does not issue electronic device orders for attorneys who haven’t appeared on ECF. He provided a link to the form for the order authorizing electronic devices. Markus, representing Ghislaine Maxwell, requested permission to bring his cell phone and laptop to the April 23rd arraignment and offered to provide a proposed order.

Robert Y. Lewis, representing a victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, contacted [REDACTED] regarding attendance at the upcoming trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. He requested priority access as a spectator, noting she would be traveling from England and not seeking government-funded travel expenses. The communication was sent through The National Crime Victim Bar Association, with a confidentiality notice attached outlining protected information.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an email with a courtesy copy of an ECF filing regarding the case U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN) to [REDACTED], Christian Everdell, Laura Mennin er, and Jeff Pagliuca. The attachment was a letter titled “Letter_to_Court_re-_42421.pdf”.

Bobbi sent a courtesy copy of an Electronic Correspondence Filing (ECF) regarding the case U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN) to [REDACTED] and [REDACTED]. The ECF filing, titled "Letter_re-fileep_Deprivation-4-29-21.pdf," is attached. Christian Everdell, Laura Mennin er, and Jeff Pagliuca are included in the "Cc:" field.

On April 29, 2021, Ori from (USANYS) contacted individuals regarding a request from Maxwell’s counsel challenging the court’s order regarding Ms. Maxwell’s sleeping conditions, specifically the 15-minute light surveillance. Bobbi Sternheim attached a courtesy copy of a filed ECF concerning the matter. The communication included a Covid-19 notice detailing the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim’s remote operations during the pandemic.

Bobbi C. Sternheim sent a courtesy copy of an ECF filing (“U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)”) to multiple recipients, including [REDACTED] and [REDACTED], via email. The email attached a letter regarding sleep deprivation (“Letter re- Sleep Deprivation-4-29-4”) and included a disclaimer regarding confidential and privileged information from the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim, outlining remote work procedures due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

A letter was filed by Maxwell’s counsel regarding sleep deprivation during her detention in the U.S. v. Maxwell S2 case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The letter requests the court order the MDC to cease 15-minute light surveillance or justify the disruptive flashlight surveillance. Bobbi C. Sternheim, Esq., sent a courtesy copy of the ECF filing. The email includes a disclaimer regarding confidential and privileged information contained within the message and attached documents.

This document is a submission to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding a subpoena request from Ghislaine Maxwell’s defense team seeking records from Boies Schiller Flexner LLP (BSF) in the U.S. v. Maxwell case. The Government respectfully opposes three specific requests (9, 10, and 11) based on the *Nixon* standard, which requires a subpoena to be narrowly tailored, relevant, admissible, and not a fishing expedition. Specifically: *   **Request 9 (Minor Victim-2’s Diary):** The Government argues this request is improper because the diary is irrelevant given that the defendant and the victim already acknowledged the absence of references to the defendant within the diary, and the diary is full of unrelated personal entries. *   **Request 10 (Pair of Boots):** The Government intends to obtain the boots through BSF and make them available to the defense for examination, effectively mooting this request. *   **Request 11 (Photographs):** The defense already possesses copies of the photographs; the Government argues that the original physical photographs lack relevant metadata and wouldn’t satisfy the *Nixon* standard without further justification. The Government requests the Court to deny Requests 9 and 11 and reserve decision on Request 10 until the Government obtains the boots and makes them available for examination.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an email attachment, a courtesy copy of the ECF filing in the case of U.S. v. Maxwell, Case Number S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), to Christian Everdell, Jeff Pagliuca, and Laura Mennin. The attachment is named Reply_to_Dkt_270.pdf and ATT00001.htm.

Bobbi C. Sternheim sent an email to [REDACTED] on May 7, 2021, forwarding a document from Maxwell’s attorneys related to the case *U.S. v. Maxwell* (S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The email included a courtesy copy of an ECF filing and a disclaimer regarding confidential and privileged information contained within the message and attachments. Laura Menninger provided Covid-19 related office updates.

Bobbi Sternheim sent a courtesy copy of ECF filing related to U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (MN) to several recipients, including Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca. The filing is attached as Reply_to_Order_Dkt_312.pdf and ATT00001.htm.

On July 13, 2021, an individual (identified as [REDACTED]) contacted CACI (USANYS) regarding order number 15JA5421F00000068, a scanning project for U.S. v. Maxwell Epstein. The sender stated they had not received any boxes to process, and inquired about submitted invoices for payment, noting the task order expired on 5/31/2021.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an email with a courtesy copy of an Electronic Case File (ECF) filing related to the U.S. v. Maxwell S2 case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The ECF filing, attached as Letter_re_VICs_8-18-18.pdf and ATT00001.htm, was sent to recipients including Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca.

On October 14, 2021, Bobbi Sternheim’s Law Offices filed a courtesy copy of an ECF filing related to U.S. v. Maxwell S2 (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) to multiple recipients including [REDACTED], Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca. The filing was sent from [REDACTED] to fla(USANYS) (USANYS).

v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (MN).” *   A draft response letter was prepared and needs review by MDC (likely a specific legal team or department) and Sophia. *   There’s a request to discuss specific language regarding Judge Nathan’s deadlines. *   The team is seeking clarification on a complex issue related to delivered materials and the defense’s footnote 1. *   They’ve contacted the BOP (Bureau of Prisons) to schedule a call. *   Bobbi Sternheim filed a courtesy copy of the ECF filing. *   There's a deadline of 5 PM on October 15, 2021, for the response.

On October 15, 2021, Bobbi Sternheim sent a response to a case, U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), attaching a defense’s letter reply and a judge’s decision. The judge’s decision stated an expectation that defendants in pre-trial postures like GM will receive legal mail within one business day, allowing for renewal of the request if delays occur. Sternheim also provided a courtesy copy of the ECF filing and updated her contact information.

A communication chain regarding the case *U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)* is being coordinated. Judge Nathan requested a response to a letter from Bobbi Sternheim by 5 pm on October 15, 2021. Efforts were made to contact the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) to schedule a call. Sternheim filed a courtesy copy of the ECF filing that evening, involving multiple legal counsel including Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeff Pagliuca, and the sender's organization, Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim.

On October 15, 2021, an email chain discusses a response to a U.S. v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330). A draft response with highlighted language was prepared and intended for review by the MDC.  There was discussion about deleting specific sentences and avoiding engagement with a defense footnote regarding material volumes. Judge Nathan ordered a response by 5 PM that day. Bobbi Sternheim filed a courtesy copy of the ECF filing that evening. A letter was being sent to the court regarding legal mail.

Nicole Simmons, of Haddon, Morgan and Foreman P C, sent a zip file containing Ms. Maxwell’s Reply In Support of Her Motions in Limine to Judge Nathan Chambers regarding the case U.S. v. Maxwell, Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN). The email was sent on October 28, 2021, and included supporting documents.

Bobbi C. Sternheim sent an email on November 3, 2021, to multiple recipients including Christian Everdel, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca. The email contained a courtesy copy of an Electronic Case File (ECF) filing related to “U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (MN)” and a PDF document titled “Disclosure of Juror Names to Counsel Only upon completion of Questionnaire.” Sternheim also reiterated her new office address and preferred email address within the email.

An email chain, dated November 3, 2021, discusses a U.S. v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The email, sent by Bobbi C. Sternheim, provides a courtesy copy of an Electronic Filing (ECF) related to the case, specifically a disclosure of juror names to counsel. The email includes Bobbi Sternheim's updated contact information and a confidentiality disclaimer.

Nathan NYSD Chambers sent an order (20cr330_Order 10.14.21.pdf) regarding the case U.S. v. Maxwell to Alison J. Nathan. The order will be filed on the public docket the following morning, and confirmation of receipt is requested.

Bobbi Sternheini sent an external email regarding the case *U.S. v. Maxwell S2* (20 Cr. 330 (MN)). The email included a courtesy copy of an ECF filing (Defense_Reply_to_Dkt_350.pdf; ATT00001.htm) and was sent to Christian Everdell, Laura Mennin, and Jeff Pagliuca.

Nathan NYSD Chambers sent an email to Laura Menninger and Jeff Pagliuca regarding a memo endorsement issued by Judge Alison J. Nathan in the case 20cr330, U.S. v. Maxwell. The memo concerns the defense’s motion on FRE 412 and was attached as a PDF named “20cr330 ME 10.15.2 1 .pdf”. Chambers intends to file the memo on the public docket on Monday morning and requests confirmation of receipt.

*   An email chain discusses a response to a legal matter, “U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).” *   A draft response is being prepared and needs to be sent to the MDC for review. *   There’s a discussion about Judge Nathan’s deadlines and a need to clarify language regarding them. *   The defense’s footnote regarding material volume is being approached cautiously. *   A letter filed by Bobbi Sternheim is being shared for informational purposes. *   Efforts are underway to contact the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) for a call.

On November 16, 2021, the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York sent additional discovery materials related to *U.S. v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (MN)) to Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeff Pagliuca, and the USANYS contractor. The materials included cover letters, indices for testifying and non-testifying witness material, and exhibit indices. The production will be delivered via USAfx, and one hard drive provided by the recipient will be sent to the MDC for Ms. Maxwell.

Bobbi Sternhei sent an external email regarding the U.S. v. Maxwell S2 case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The email attached a courtesy copy of an ECF filing titled "Response_to_Govt_voir dire_opposition.pdf" and an HTML document (ATT00001.htm). Christian Everdell, Laura Mennin, and Jeff Pagliuca were included in the “To” field.

Bobbi C. Sternheim sent an email forwarding a response to government voir dire opposition in the case of *U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)*. The email included a courtesy copy of an ECF filing and updated contact information for Sternheim. The email contained a confidentiality disclaimer regarding the Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim.

An email chain discusses the attachment and sharing of 13 motions in limine filed by the defense in the case *U.S. v. Maxwell* (Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The motions were organized and shared via a shared drive and a URL, with Nicole Simmons providing the documents at the request of Jeffrey Pagliuca. Redactions were present on the document.

An email chain discusses Ms. Maxwell’s 13 motions in limine filed in the U.S. v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330). Nicole Simmons attached the motions and supporting cover letters from the Wisa.doj.gov cloud share drive, responding to a request for access and distribution from Nathan NYSD Chambers and Jeff Pagliuca.

Nicole Simmons sent a zipped file containing Ms. Maxwell’s Motions in Limine and supporting documents to Judge Nathan NYSD Chambers in the case of U.S. v. Maxwell, Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), at the request of Jeffrey Pagliuca.

On November 22, 2021, Cohen & Gresser LLP sent a letter to the Chambers regarding a defendant’s letter concerning proposed limiting instructions in the case of *U.S. v. Maxwell*. The letter, attached as a PDF, was initially submitted under seal. The email also included confidentiality and privacy notices.

On November 23, 2021, a press guidance was issued in advance of the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell in the SDNY court. The guidance stated that witnesses would be testifying under pseudonyms due to the sensitive nature of the accusations involving sexual abuse and contact. Government exhibits will be provided through a file share, and media representatives are encouraged to establish a PACER account and contact the press office at (212) 637-2600 for questions.

Nicole Simmons, of Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., sent a response to the Government’s Omnibus Motions in Limine from Jane Maxwell in the case of U.S. v. Maxwell, Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN). The response was at the request of Jeffrey Pagliuca and is attached as a zip file.

Nicole Simmons of Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C. sent an email to Nathan NYSD Chambers and Jeff Pagliuca regarding the case *U.S. v. Maxwell, Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)*. The email contained Ms. Maxwell's reply brief in support of her motions in limine, along with the government’s reply brief (unredacted), and an image.

Bobbi C. Sternheim sent an external email to multiple recipients regarding the U.S. v. Maxwell S2 case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The email included a courtesy copy of an ECF filing and her updated contact information. It also contained a standard disclaimer regarding confidential and privileged information within the message and attached documents. A redaction was noted on page 1.

Bobbi C. Sternheim sent an external email to multiple recipients regarding the U.S. v. Maxwell S2 case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The email included a courtesy copy of an Electronic Filed Communication (ECF) filing and her updated contact information. The email also contained a standard confidentiality and disclaimer notice regarding the contents of the message and attached documents.

Email correspondence regarding the U.S. v. Maxwell case (20Cr330), specifically concerning Ms. Maxwell’s Rule 16(b)(1)(C) disclosures. The emails were sent between Nicole Simmons of Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. and various individuals including Jeffrey Pagliuca, Laura Menninger, and Ryan Hall, sharing a zip file containing the disclosures.

Bobbi C. Sternheim is sending a courtesy copy of an ECF filing (Docket 423) related to U.S. v. Maxwell S2. She provides her updated contact information: ternheim and confirms the confidential and privileged nature of the message and attached documents. The document is labeled EFTA00010016.

Nicole Simmons, from Haddon. Morgan and Foreman, P.C., submitted Ms. Maxwell’s Response to the Government’s Motion In Limine to Preclude Expert Testimony of Dr. Park Dietz and Dr. Elizabeth Loftus, along with supporting documents (Ex._1.pdf, Ex._2.pdf) to Judge Nathan in the U.S. v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The documents were initially submitted under a temporary seal to allow the government to propose redactions.

Nicole Simmons of Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. sent a response to a motion by the U.S. government in the case of *U.S. v. Maxwell* (Case No. 20 Cr. 330). The response, authored by Ms. Maxwell, addresses the government’s motion to preclude expert testimony from Dr. Park Dietz and Dr. Elizabeth Loftus. The documents were initially submitted under temporary seal to allow the government to propose redactions.

Nicole Simmons, on behalf of Haddon, Morgan and Foreman P.C., submitted Ms. Maxwell’s response to the Government’s Motion In Limine to Preclude Expert Testimony of Dr. Park Dietz and Dr. Elizabeth Loftus in the case of U.S. v. Maxwell, Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN). The response, along with supporting documents (Ex._1.pdf and Ex._2.pdf), was initially submitted under temporary seal to allow the government to propose redactions. The email chain originates from Nathan NYSD Chambers and includes Jeff Pagliuca and Laura Mennin.

Bobbi C. Sternheim, Esq., sent courtesy copies of electronic filings related to U.S. v. Maxwell S2 (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The filings included a Bail Application and disclosures regarding juror names. Sternheim provided her updated office address and email address in the communications. The documents contained confidentiality and privilege notices.

Nicole Simmons, on behalf of Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., submitted Ms. Maxwell’s Letters in Response to the Government’s justifications for admitting co-conspirator statements and Exhibit 52 in the case of U.S. v. Maxwell (Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The letters were initially submitted under temporary seal to allow the government to propose redactions.

A letter from Cohen & Gresser LLP to the Chambers regarding a defense response to a court's opinion and order in U.S. v. Maxwell. The defense submitted a letter temporarily under seal regarding proposed limiting instructions. The letter was attached as a PDF and included supporting images.

Bobbi Sternheim, representing the defense in the U.S. v. Maxwell case (Case No. 20 Cr. 330), reports that the government has agreed to serve the moving parties after applying redactions to documents. Specifically, the EVCP has been served. Nicole Simmons, representing Jeffrey Pagliuca, submitted Maxwell’s Response to the Letter Motions to Quash, initially under temporary seal to allow for government redaction review. The parties are awaiting the government’s final redaction decisions before full service is completed.

Nicole Simmons, on behalf of Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., submitted a response to motions to quash in the case of *U.S. v. Maxwell* (Case No. 20 Cr. 330) regarding a Rule 17(c) subpoena to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program. The response was initially submitted under temporary seal, allowing the government to propose redactions.

Bobbi Sternheim, representing the defense, reports that the government has confirmed all moving parties have been served, including the EVCP.  She and her team are awaiting government approval for redactions to documents submitted to the court. Nathan Chambers requested confirmation of service and Nicole Simmons submitted Maxwell’s response to the motion to quash, initially under temporary seal pending government redaction review. All parties acknowledge the confidential and privileged nature of the communications and adherence to email safety protocols.

A legal production, including Rule 16 and 3500 productions, related to the U.S. v. Maxwell case, was prepared and sent to defense counsel via FedEx drive. The drive and password were provided with tracking numbers. The production was uploaded to USAfx. A time-sensitive review of the 3500 index was requested, and the materials were located on Msa.doj.gov\cloud NYS. Cover letters and Excel indices were attached for review and potential changes.
